subject: println => out of memory
msgSnippet: Hey, One thing that is a frequent issue with our students using junit on the testing server: junit captures std[out/err] and stores it in a memory-backed
messageBody:
Hey,

One thing that is a frequent issue with our students using junit on
the testing server: junit captures std[out/err] and stores it in a
memory-backed buffer. When students put too much debugging code, the
junit process will completely die. I'm wondering if it'd be rational
to put some sort of limit on the size of the buffer used (maybe via a
system property).

-- Ben
